ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Did your child take any medications other than vitamins and iron?
Has your child ever taken any mood or behavioral medications?
How many different mood or behavioral medications has your child ever taken?
Ordinal number
Notes: 1 = first; 2 = second; 3 = third; 4 = fourth; 5 = fifth; 6 = sixth; 7 = seventh; 8 = eighth; 9 = ninth; 10 = tenth; 11 = eleventh; 12 = twelfth; 13 = thirteenth; 14 = fourteenth; 15 = fifteenth

ElementDescription: What was the [nth] mood or behavioral medication that [childfirst] took?
Is your child currently taking a mood or behavioral medication?
If so, how many mood or behavioral medications is your child CURRENTLY taking?
What is the [nth] mood or behavioral medication that your child currently takes?
How much of [nth] medication does child take?
Units ([nth] medication)
When did your child begin taking [nth] medication?
When did your child discontinue taking [nth] medication?  Note: If child is still currently taking the medication, leave this blank.
Why is (was) your child taking [nth] medication?
Has your child ever taken a steroid or used an asthma inhaler?
Is your child currently using a steroid or asthma inhaler?
Type (Medication brand (e.g., Albuterol)) of Inhaler or Steroid
